query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
7 E io, continüando al mio sermone, 8 dissi: «Ella sen va sù forse più tarda 9 che non farebbe, per altrui cagione.
query.result:
**English:**
7 And I, continuing my discourse, 8 said: "She is perhaps going up later 9 than she would, because of another reason.
**Sanskrit:**
7 Aham ca, mama vacanaṃ pravarttayan, 8 uvāca: "Sā kimcid vilambena gacchati, 9 anyasya kāraṇāt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
10 Ma dimmi, se tu sai, dov’ è Piccarda; 11 dimmi s’io veggio da notar persona 12 tra questa gente che sì mi riguarda».
query.result:
**English:**
10 But tell me, if you know, where is Piccarda; 11 tell me if I see anyone worthy of note 12 among these people who are watching me so intently.
**Sanskrit:**
10 Api tu mama vaktavyam, yadi jānāsi, Piccardā katham asti; 11 mama vaktavyam, kim aham paśyāmi kaṃcid vyaktiṃ smaraṇīyāṃ 12 asmin jana-saṃghāte yaḥ mama prati dṛṣṭim dadāti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
13 «La mia sorella, che tra bella e buona 14 non so qual fosse più, trïunfa lieta 15 ne l’alto Olimpo già di sua corona».
query.result:
**English:**
13 "My sister, who between beautiful and good 14 I do not know which was more, triumphs joyful 15 in high Olympus already with her crown."
**Sanskrit:**
13 Mama bhaginī, yā madhye sundaraṃ ca śubhaṃ ca 14 Na jānāmi kataraṃ adhikaṃ āsīt, vijayate prasannā 15 Uccaiḥ Olimpe sva-makuṭena.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
16 Sì disse prima; e poi: «Qui non si vieta 17 di nominar ciascun, da ch’è sì munta 18 nostra sembianza via per la dïeta.
query.result:
**English:**
16 Thus he said first; and then: "Here it is not forbidden 17 to name each one, since our appearance is so wasted 18 along the way because of our diet.
**Sanskrit:**
16 Evam āha pūrvam; tataś ca: "Atra na pratiṣiddham 17 abhidhātum ekaikam, yataḥ evam kṣīṇā 18 asmākam ākṛtiḥ pathi āhārasya nimittena.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
19 Questi», e mostrò col dito, «è Bonagiunta, 20 Bonagiunta da Lucca; e quella faccia 21 di là da lui più che l’altre trapunta
22 ebbe la Santa Chiesa in le sue braccia: 23 dal Torso fu, e purga per digiuno 24 l’anguille di Bolsena e la vernaccia».
query.result:
**English:**
19 "This one," and he pointed with his finger, "is Bonagiunta, 20 Bonagiunta da Lucca; and that face 21 over there, more scarred than the others,
22 was held in the arms of the Holy Church: 23 he was from Tours, and he purges by fasting 24 the eels of Bolsena and the vernaccia wine."
**Sanskrit:**
19 "Eṣaḥ," iti ca angulirśanena pradarśitavān, "Bonagiuntaḥ, 20 Bonagiuntaḥ da Luccaḥ; tatra ca mukham 21 tatraiva tasmāt param adhikaṃ vinirbhinnam
22 āsīt Santaḥ Sabhāḥ tasya bhujau: 23 sa Torsoḥ āsīt, tataś ca prayaścittam karoti upavāsena 24 Bolsena-nagarasya matsyair madhupiṇḍena ca."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
25 Molti altri mi nomò ad uno ad uno; 26 e del nomar parean tutti contenti, 27 sì ch’io però non vidi un atto bruno.
query.result:
**English:**
25 Many others he named to me, one by one; 26 and all seemed content to be named, 27 so that I saw not one who was sullen.
**Sanskrit:**
25 Aneke 'nye ca mām abhidadhur ekaikam; 26 Tānāmnāpy ākhyātum sarve santuṣṭāḥ āsann iti, 27 Tathāpi na mayā kaścid dṛṣṭaḥ kṣubhitaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
28 Vidi per fame a vòto usar li denti 29 Ubaldin da la Pila e Bonifazio 30 che pasturò col rocco molte genti.
query.result:
**English:**
28 I saw Ubaldin della Pila and Bonifazio 29 using their teeth for hunger, 30 he who shepherded many people with his crook.
**Sanskrit:**
28 Kṣudhāyāṃ dantān prayujyamānān apaśyam 29 Ubaldinam della Pilaṃ ca Bonifāzyam ca, 30 yaḥ aṅkuśena bahūn janān pālayām āsa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
31 Vidi messer Marchese, ch’ebbe spazio 32 già di bere a Forlì con men secchezza, 33 e sì fu tal, che non si sentì sazio.
query.result:
**English:**
31 I saw Sir Marquis, who had the opportunity 32 to drink in Forlì with less dryness, 33 and he was such that he did not feel satisfied.
**Sanskrit:**
31 Apaśyam śrīmāṃs tamarkeśam yasya āsīt avakāśaḥ 32 pūrvam Forlī-nagare pītum kṣudhā-tṛṣṇā-vinā, 33 evam ca āsīt saḥ yaḥ na anubhavati tṛptiṃ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
34 Ma come fa chi guarda e poi s’apprezza 35 più d’un che d’altro, fei a quel da Lucca, 36 che più parea di me aver contezza.
query.result:
**English:**
34 But as one who looks and then draws near 35 more to one than to another, I did to that one from Lucca, 36 who seemed to have more knowledge than I.
**Sanskrit:**
34 Yathā ca karoti yaḥ paśyati tataḥ prāpnoti ca 35 anyebhyaḥ adhikaṃ kasyacit, tathā ahaṃ cakāra tena saha Luccā-vāsinā, 36 yaḥ mama apramāṇatamaṃ jñānam iva adhikam adṛśyata.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 El mormorava; e non so che «Gentucca» 38 sentiv’ io là, ov’ el sentia la piaga 39 de la giustizia che sì li pilucca.
query.result:
**English:**
37 It murmured; and I know not what "Gentucca" 38 I heard there, where I felt the wound 39 of justice that so mangles them.
**Sanskrit:**
37 Saḥ śabdayati sma; na ca jānāmi kim "Gentucca" 38 śṛṇomi sma tatra, yatra aham anubhavāmi vyathām 39 nyāyasya yā tān evam viṣaṇīkaroti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
40 «O anima», diss’ io, «che par sì vaga 41 di parlar meco, fa sì ch’io t’intenda, 42 e te e me col tuo parlare appaga».
query.result:
**English:**
40 "O soul," I said, "who seem so eager 41 to speak with me, make me understand you, 42 and satisfy both you and me with your speech."
**Sanskrit:**
40 "He jīva," iti aham uvāca, "yā tvam mama saha samvāde 41 ittham ātmabhāvam āpanna iva prādṛśyase, 42 mama ca tava ca manaḥ svakīyena vākyena samtuṣṭam kuru."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
43 «Femmina è nata, e non porta ancor benda», 44 cominciò el, «che ti farà piacere 45 la mia città, come ch’om la riprenda.
query.result:
**English:**
43 "A woman is born, and she does not yet wear a veil," 44 he began, "who will make you love 45 my city, however much one may blame it.
**Sanskrit:**
43 Strī jāta, na ca vastram adhuna bibharti, 44 sa tvām prīṇayisyati, 45 mama nagarīṃ, yadyapi tāṃ nindanti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
46 Tu te n’andrai con questo antivedere: 47 se nel mio mormorar prendesti errore, 48 dichiareranti ancor le cose vere.
query.result:
**English:**
46 You will go with this foresight: 47 if you took error in my murmuring, 48 the true things will still declare you.
**Sanskrit:**
46 Tvam etena pūrvadarśanena gamiṣyasi: 47 yadi mama marmare bhramaḥ prāptaḥ asti, 48 satyāni api vastūni tvām prakāśayiṣyanti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
49 Ma dì s’i’ veggio qui colui che fore 50 trasse le nove rime, cominciando 51 ‘Donne ch’avete intelletto d’amore’».
query.result:
**English:**
49 But tell me, do I see here the one who first 50 composed the nine rhymes, beginning 51 "Ladies who have intelligence of love"?
**Sanskrit:**
49 Api tu mama kathaya kim atra paśyāmi tam yaḥ prathamam navaḥ padya-racchāḥ racayām āsa, ārabhya 51 "Hey strī-janaḥ yāsu premṇaḥ vivekaḥ asti."
Please note that the translation into Sanskrit is not a word-for-word literal translation, as that would not be natural or idiomatic in Sanskrit. However, it is a faithful rendering of the meaning of the original Italian lines.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
52 E io a lui: «I’ mi son un che, quando 53 Amor mi spira, noto, e a quel modo 54 ch’e’ ditta dentro vo significando».
query.result:
**English:**
52 And I to him: "I am one who, when 53 Love inspires me, takes note, and in that manner 54 which is dictated within I go on to signify."
**Sanskrit:**
52 Aham ca tasmai: "Aham asmi yaḥ, yadā 53 Kāmaḥ māṃ spṛṇoti, jānāmi, tena ca prakāreṇa 54 Yathā antaḥ uktam asti, tat prakāśayann agacchāmi."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
55 «O frate, issa vegg’ io», diss’ elli, «il nodo 56 che ’l Notaro e Guittone e me ritenne 57 di qua dal dolce stil novo ch’i’ odo!
58 Io veggio ben come le vostre penne 59 di retro al dittator sen vanno strette, 60 che de le nostre certo non avvenne;
61 e qual più a gradire oltre si mette, 62 non vede più da l’uno a l’altro stilo»; 63 e, quasi contentato, si tacette.
query.result:
**English:**
55 "O brother, now I see," he said, "the knot 56 that kept Notary and Guittone and me 57 on this side of the sweet new style that I hear!
58 I see clearly how your pens 59 follow closely behind the dictator, 60 which certainly did not happen with ours;
61 and whoever tries to go further to please 62 no longer sees the difference from one style to another"; 63 and, almost satisfied, he falls silent.
**Sanskrit:**
55 "He bhrātar, adya paśyāmi," uvāca sa, "granthim 56 yaḥ śāsanakāraṃ guṇṭhanam ca mām api 57 amutra madhuraṃ navaṃ śailiṃ śṛṇomi yaṃ aham!
58 Paśyāmi suṣṭhu yathā yuṣmākaṃ lekhani 59 likhakāraṃ prāpya paścād anuvartamānā bhavanti niviḍāni, 60 yat na khalu asmākaṃ niścitam abhavat;
61 yaś ca adhikaṃ rocate iti atiśayena prayatate, 62 na paśyati adhikaṃ ekasmād anyad api śailiṃ prati"; 63 tathā ca samtuṣṭa iva maunaṃ babhūva.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
64 Come li augei che vernan lungo ’l Nilo, 65 alcuna volta in aere fanno schiera, 66 poi volan più a fretta e vanno in filo,
67 così tutta la gente che lì era, 68 volgendo ’l viso, raffrettò suo passo, 69 e per magrezza e per voler leggera.
query.result:
**English:**
64 Like the birds that in winter along the Nile, 65 sometimes in the air make a flock, 66 then fly more swiftly and go in a line,
67 so all the people who were there, 68 turning their faces, hastened their pace, 69 and because of their thinness and desire to be light.
**Sanskrit:**
64 Yathā pakṣiṇaḥ hemante Nīlasya tīre, 65 kadācit ākāśe samūham kurvanti, 66 tataḥ adhikaṃ vegaṃ prāpya ekaśreṇyā gacchanti,
67 tathā sarve janāḥ ye tatra āsīt, 68 vaktram āvartya, svaṃ padaṃ prerapayām āsu, 69 kṛśatvena ca laghutvam icchantaś ca.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
70 E come l’uom che di trottare è lasso, 71 lascia andar li compagni, e sì passeggia 72 fin che si sfoghi l’affollar del casso,
73 sì lasciò trapassar la santa greggia 74 Forese, e dietro meco sen veniva, 75 dicendo: «Quando fia ch’io ti riveggia?».
query.result:
**English:**
70 And like the man who is weary from running, 71 lets his companions go on, and walks slowly 72 until he recovers from his breathlessness,
73 so Forese let the holy flock pass by, 74 and came walking behind me, 75 saying: "When will I see you again?"
**Sanskrit:**
70 Evaṃ ca yaḥ puruṣaḥ dhavataḥ śrāntaḥ asti, 71 saḥ sahacārān muñcati, evam ca viharati 72 yāvat svāsasya samāptiḥ bhavati,
73 tathā Forese puṇyāṃ paśu-saṃghātim atītayām ākarṣayām āsa, 74 paścāt mama saha āgacchan, 75 evam vadan: "kadā tvām punar api drakṣyāmi?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
82 «Or va», diss’ el; «che quei che più n’ha colpa, 83 vegg’ ïo a coda d’una bestia tratto 84 inver’ la valle ove mai non si scolpa.

Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
85 La bestia ad ogne passo va più ratto, 86 crescendo sempre, fin ch’ella il percuote, 87 e lascia il corpo vilmente disfatto.
query.result:
**English:**
85 The beast at every step goes faster, 86 ever increasing, until it strikes him down, 87 and leaves the body vilely mangled.
**Sanskrit:**
85 Paśur ekaikameva padakrameṇa gacchan ativṛddhaḥ bhavati, 86 vardhamānaḥ sadā, yāvat tam āhataḥ karoti, 87 śarīram ca nīcavatyāgena vināśitam karoti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
88 Non hanno molto a volger quelle ruote», 89 e drizzò li occhi al ciel, «che ti fia chiaro 90 ciò che ’l mio dir più dichiarar non puote.
query.result:
**English:**
88 Those wheels do not have much more to turn, 89 and he raised his eyes to heaven, "which will make clear to you 90 what my words cannot explain more clearly."
**Sanskrit:**
88 Na bahu parivartanaṃ kartavyam teṣām cakrāṇām, 89 ca akṣīṇy udvāhitavān nabhaḥ-tale, "yad bhavatā jñātavyam, 90 tat mama kathanaṃ vistareṇa na śakyate vaktuṃ."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
91 Tu ti rimani omai; ché ’l tempo è caro 92 in questo regno, sì ch’io perdo troppo 93 venendo teco sì a paro a paro».
query.result:
**English:**
91 You remain here now; for time is precious 92 in this realm, so I lose too much 93 coming with you side by side like this."
**Sanskrit:**
91 Tvam ihāsthāḥ; kālaḥ khalv ayam adhikaḥ 92 asmin rājyām, yataḥ aham atiriktam nāśayāmi 93 tvayā saha evam samam āgacchan."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
94 Qual esce alcuna volta di gualoppo 95 lo cavalier di schiera che cavalchi, 96 e va per farsi onor del primo intoppo,
97 tal si partì da noi con maggior valchi; 98 e io rimasi in via con esso i due 99 che fuor del mondo sì gran marescalchi.
query.result:
**English:**
94 As sometimes a horseman spurs his steed 95 when he is in the front rank of the squadron, 96 and goes to win honor in the first encounter,
97 so he departed from us with greater strides; 98 and I remained on the way with those two 99 who were such great marshals outside the world.
**Sanskrit:**
94 Yathā kadācit gavalanaḥ aśvavāhakaḥ 95 purodhaḥ śreṇyāḥ āruhya aśvam, 96 ādiṣaḍbhede prathame yaśaḥ prāptavān,
97 tathā sa asmāt adhikam valguḥ pravṛttaḥ; 98 aham ca mārge sthitaḥ abhavam ubhayayor saha, 99 ye lokasya bahiḥ atiśayitau senāpatī.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
100 E quando innanzi a noi intrato fue, 101 che li occhi miei si fero a lui seguaci, 102 come la mente a le parole sue,
103 parvermi i rami gravidi e vivaci 104 d’un altro pomo, e non molto lontani 105 per esser pur allora vòlto in laci.
query.result:
**English:**
100 And when he had entered before us, 101 so that my eyes became his followers, 102 as my mind followed his words,
103 the branches seemed to me heavy and lively 104 with another fruit, and not very far away, 105 since it had just then turned into snares.
**Sanskrit:**
100 Evaṃ ca yadā sa asmākam agre praviṣṭaḥ abhūt, 101 yathā mama netrāṇi tasya anugāmini bhavanti sma, 102 yathā mama manaḥ tasya vacanaṃ anugacchati sma,
103 tadā mama tāḥ śākhāḥ garbhāṇvitāḥ prāṇavatyaś ca adṛśyanta, 104 anyasya api phalasya, na ca ati dūre, 105 yataḥ sa tadā eva pāśe parivṛttaḥ āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
106 Vidi gente sott’ esso alzar le mani 107 e gridar non so che verso le fronde, 108 quasi bramosi fantolini e vani
109 che pregano, e ’l pregato non risponde, 110 ma, per fare esser ben la voglia acuta, 111 tien alto lor disio e nol nasconde.
query.result:
**English:**
106 I saw people beneath it raising their hands 107 and crying out I know not what toward the leaves, 108 like greedy and vain little children
109 who beg, and the one begged does not respond, 110 but, to make the desire sharp, 111 he keeps their longing high and does not hide it.
**Sanskrit:**
106 Adhaḥ tasya paśyāmi janaṃ hastau utkṣipantaṃ 107 ca krandantaṃ na jānāmi kim patram prati, 108 yathā lolupaḥ bālaḥ mūḍhaśca
109 yaḥ prārthayate, prārthitaśca na pratipadyate, 110 api tu tatkāmasya tikrīkaraṇāya, 111 unnataṃ karoti tasya kāmaṃ na ca gopāyati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
112 Poi si partì sì come ricreduta; 113 e noi venimmo al grande arbore adesso, 114 che tanti prieghi e lagrime rifiuta.
query.result:
**English:**
112 Then she departed, as she had been entreated; 113 and we came to the great tree now, 114 which rejects so many prayers and tears.
**Sanskrit:**
112 Tataḥ sā jagāma yathā prārthitā āsīt; 113 Atha vayam āgatāḥ sma mahattarakavṛkṣasya samīpam adhunā, 114 Yaḥ tāvatīnāṃ prārthanānāṃ rudanānāṃ ca pratiṣedhaṃ karoti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
115 «Trapassate oltre sanza farvi presso: 116 legno è più sù che fu morso da Eva, 117 e questa pianta si levò da esso».
query.result:
**English:**
115 "Pass on beyond without stopping: 116 the tree is higher up that was bitten by Eve, 117 and this plant sprang from it."
**Sanskrit:**
115 "Atiśīghramatikramya gacchata, na sthātavyam atra: 116 vṛkṣaḥ asti adhikaḥ ūrdhve yaḥ āsid abhakṣitaḥ Evayā, 117 ayam ca vṛkṣaḥ tasmāt eva jātaḥ."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
118 Sì tra le frasche non so chi diceva; 119 per che Virgilio e Stazio e io, ristretti, 120 oltre andavam dal lato che si leva.
query.result:
**English:**
118 Thus among the leaves I know not who was speaking; 119 so Virgil and Statius and I, huddled together, 120 went onward along the side that rises.
**Sanskrit:**
118 Evam patrapāṇḍuṣu na jānāmi kaḥ avocat; 119 tasmāt Virgiliḥ Statyaśca aham ca, samākulāḥ, 120 agre agacchamaḥ tasmin pakṣe yaḥ uttiṣṭhati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
127 Sì accostati a l’un d’i due vivagni 128 passammo, udendo colpe de la gola 129 seguite già da miseri guadagni.
query.result:
**English:**
127 Thus we approached one of the two living flames, 128 hearing the sins of gluttony 129 followed now by wretched gains.
**Sanskrit:**
127 Evam upajagmivāvaṃ tadubhayor jīvajvālayoḥ ekam, 128 śṛṇvantau pāpāni lobhasya, 129 anugamyair dīnaih sampadādibhiḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
130 Poi, rallargati per la strada sola, 131 ben mille passi e più ci portar oltre, 132 contemplando ciascun sanza parola.
query.result:
**English:**
130 Then, continuing along the lonely road, 131 a good thousand paces and more we went beyond, 132 each one contemplating, without a word.
**Sanskrit:**
130 Tataḥ, eka eva mārgeṇa gacchantau, 131 Sahasram padānām adhikaṃ ca asmān atikrāntavān, 132 Ekaikaḥ cintanayā vinā vacanam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
133 «Che andate pensando sì voi sol tre?». 134 sùbita voce disse; ond’ io mi scossi 135 come fan bestie spaventate e poltre.
query.result:
**English:**
133 "What are you three thinking about so intently?". 134 A sudden voice said; whereupon I started 135 like frightened and cowardly beasts.
**Sanskrit:**
133 "Kim vicintayathā yūyam traya eva?". 134 Ākasmād vāg abravīt; yataḥ aham acakṣubhe 135 Yathā kṛtā bhayāḥ paśavaḥ śīghrāḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
136 Drizzai la testa per veder chi fossi; 137 e già mai non si videro in fornace 138 vetri o metalli sì lucenti e rossi,
139 com’ io vidi un che dicea: «S’a voi piace 140 montare in sù, qui si convien dar volta; 141 quinci si va chi vuole andar per pace».
query.result:
**English:**
136 I raised my head to see who it was; 137 and never were glass or metals seen in a furnace 138 so bright and red,
139 as I saw one who said: "If it pleases you 140 to climb up, here you must turn; 141 here one goes who wants to go for peace."
**Sanskrit:**
136 Utkṣiptaṃ śiraḥ paśyāmi kasya ayam iti; 137 Na ca kadācid dṛṣṭāni bhaṭṭyāṃ 138 Kācaṃ vā lohaṃ vā tathā prakāśamānau raktau ca,
139 Yathā aham ekam apaśyam vadantam: "Yadi vām rocate 140 Āruhya upari, atraiva āvartanaṃ kartavyam; 141 Atraiva gacchati yaḥ śāntim icchati."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
142 L’aspetto suo m’avea la vista tolta; 143 per ch’io mi volsi dietro a’ miei dottori, 144 com’ om che va secondo ch’elli ascolta.
query.result:
**English:**
142 Her appearance had taken away my sight; 143 so that I turned back to my teachers, 144 like one who goes as he hears.
**Sanskrit:**
142 Tasyāḥ svarūpeṇa me cakṣuḥ apahṛtam āsīt; 143 Atas tasmāt aham punaḥ svagurūn prati apavartate sma, 144 Yathā ekaḥ puruṣaḥ śṛṇoti tathaiva gacchati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
151 E senti’ dir: «Beati cui alluma 152 tanto di grazia, che l’amor del gusto 153 nel petto lor troppo disir non fuma,
154 esurïendo sempre quanto è giusto!».
query.result:
**English:**
151 And I heard it say: "Blessed are those to whom 152 so much grace is kindled, that the love of taste 153 does not smoke in their breast with too much desire,
154 hungering always for as much as is right!".
**Sanskrit:**
151 Evaṃ ca śrutvāhaṃ tadā: "Saubhāgyavānti te, 152 yeṣāṃ tāvadanugrahaḥ prakāśate, 153 yena rasasnehasya hṛdi na atiśayo jāyate,
154 sadā yathāvad eva kṣudhāṃ kurvatām!".
